This is the famous **“Napoleon I as Emperor”** portrait, painted by **Jacques-Louis David** (often mistakenly attributed to Ingres — the signature “INGRES.P.” at the bottom left is likely an error or misattribution, as David was the actual artist of this work).

**Key details confirming it is Napoleon:**

*   **The Figure:** The subject is a man with Napoleon’s distinct facial features — his sharp jawline, prominent nose, and intense gaze.
*   **The Regalia:** He is depicted as Emperor, wearing the **Imperial Robe** (robe à l’ancienne), the **Imperial Mantle** (mantle with black ermine), and the **Imperial Crown**. He holds the **Sceptre** (symbolizing royal authority) in his right hand and the **Orb** (symbolizing dominion over the world) in his left hand — these are the traditional symbols of imperial power.
*   **The Setting:** He is seated on the **Throne of Saint Peter**, a symbol of his claim to universal authority.
*   **The Signature:** The signature “INGRES.P.” is incorrect. The'}]
